item.title: 认识七位美国顶级个人理财影响者
item.description:
他们可能来自非传统背景，但理财建议在网上从未如此火爆。【原文：

They might come from unconventional backgrounds, but financial advice has never been hotter online.

】

item.title: 特朗普的关税战让美国小企业无处藏身
item.description:
与规模较大的竞争对手相比，企业吸收成本或讨价还价以获得特殊待遇的能力较弱。【原文：

Firms have less ability to absorb costs, or bargain for special treatment, than bigger rivals.

】

item.title: 因高利率和关税担忧，住宅建筑商接近 S&P 500 指数底部
item.description: 投资者抛弃美国住宅建筑商股票的速度创下新高，因为借贷成本上升挫伤了该行业的前景，并预示着这些股票可能会进一步下跌。【原文：Investors are ditching US homebuilder stocks at a record pace as elevated borrowing costs bruise the industry’s prospects and signal that the shares may have further to fall.】

item.title: DeepSeek 承诺罕见地共享更多人工智能代码
item.description: 中国人工智能巨头 DeepSeek 计划从下周起向公众公布关键代码和数据，这是与 OpenAI 等竞争对手不同寻常的一步，旨在分享更多核心技术。【原文：Chinese AI sensation DeepSeek plans to release key codes and data to the public starting next week, an unusual step to share more of its core technology than rivals such as OpenAI have done.】

item.title: 阿达尼绿色公司寻求以卢比重铸 11 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）控制的阿达尼绿色能源有限公司（Adani Green Energy Ltd.）正在与包括电力金融公司（Power Finance Corp. ）在内的当地贷款机构谈判，以卢比为多达 11 亿美元的美元债务进行再融资。【原文：Adani Green Energy Ltd., controlled by Indian billionaire Gautam Adani, is in talks with local lenders including Power Finance Corp. to refinance as much as $1.1 billion worth of dollar debt in rupees, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴巨型可转债 25 年上涨 38%，居同行之首
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）今年的投资表现可圈可点：不仅股价飙升了 60% 以上，其可转换债券也大幅上涨。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. is turning out to be a great investment this year: Not only its shares have jumped more than 60%, its convertible bonds are also up big time.】

item.title: 英国制造业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，企业受滞胀影响，裁员情况加剧
item.description: 一项受到密切关注的调查显示，由于企业面临 "滞胀 "背景和新工作枯竭，英国企业在 2 月份加快了裁员步伐。【原文：UK businesses stepped up the pace of job cuts in February, as firms faced a “stagflationary” backdrop and new work dried up, according to a closely watched survey.】

item.title: 日元疲软影响旅行，仅 17% 的日本人拥有护照
item.description: 日本外务省周四公布的数据显示，尽管大批游客涌入日本，创下历史新高，但日本国民出国旅游的热情却在下降，目前只有六分之一的日本人拥有护照。【原文：Even as swathes of tourists pour into Japan in record numbers, the country’s citizens are showing less enthusiasm to venture abroad with only one in six Japanese now owning a passport, according to data released by Japan’s foreign ministry on Thursday.】

item.title: 德国投票前的欧元期权标志着市场的自满情绪
item.description: 随着本周末德国大选时间的流逝，欧元交易员有可能会过于安逸。【原文：Euro traders risk getting too comfortable as the clock ticks down to German elections this weekend.】

item.title: 瑞典报告波罗的海海底电缆再次受损
item.description: 另一条海底电缆在波罗的海瑞典哥特兰岛近海破裂。【原文：Another subsea cable was ruptured offshore the Swedish island of Gotland in the Baltic Sea.】

item.title: 银行如何变成巨型合成对冲基金
item.description:
放贷人是否在做大赌注的生意？【原文：

Are lenders in the business of making big bets?

】

item.title: 奇货可居：银行如何成为巨型合成对冲基金（播客）
item.description: 奇货可居：银行如何成为巨型合成对冲基金（播客）【原文：Odd Lots: How Banks Became Giant Synthetic Hedge Funds (Podcast)】

item.title: 欧元区私营部门增长乏力，德国带来希望
item.description: 2 月份，欧元区的商业活动几乎没有恢复增长，这加剧了人们对欧元区仍深陷停滞的担忧。【原文：Business activity in the euro area hardly grew again in February, reinforcing fears that the bloc remains mired in stagnation.】

item.title: 德国私营部门活动在大选前有所改善
item.description: 随着制造业衰退的缓解，德国私营部门产出在周日临时大选前的改善幅度超过预期。【原文：German private-sector output improved more than anticipated ahead of Sunday’s snap election as the manufacturing recession eased.】

item.title: 民调显示丹麦人支持向乌克兰派遣维和人员
item.description: 丹麦是乌克兰最大的军事捐助国之一，根据一项民意调查，丹麦选民赞成在战争结束后向乌克兰派遣维和人员。【原文：Voters in Denmark, one of the biggest military donors to Ukraine, are in favor of sending peacekeepers to the country once the war is over, according to an opinion poll.】

item.title: 法国商业活动意外降至2023年以来最低点
item.description: 法国私营部门的商业活动意外下滑至 2023 年以来的最低水平，长期的政治危机给欧元区第二大经济体带来了沉重的压力。【原文：Private-sector business activity in France unexpectedly slumped to its lowest level since 2023 as a prolonged political crisis weighs on the euro zone’s No. 2 economy.】

item.title: 菲律宾将准备金率下调 200 个基点至 5
item.description: 菲律宾中央银行将从 3 月 28 日起把大型银行的存款准备金率下调 200 个基点，降至 5%。【原文：The Philippine central bank will slash the reserve requirement ratio for big banks by 200 basis points to 5% effective March 28.】

item.title: StanChart 首席执行官薪酬增长 46%，奖金总额增加
item.description: 渣打银行首席执行官比尔-温特斯（Bill Winters）宣布了一项重大的成本削减计划，并实现了 21% 的盈利增长，因此他的总薪酬在 2024 年猛增了 46%。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc Chief Executive Officer Bill Winters saw his total pay package jump 46% in 2024 as he announced a major cost-cutting program and delivered a 21% increase in earnings.】

item.title: 英国一月份借贷情况不佳，将超出预期
item.description: 英国 1 月份的预算盈余少于预期，这使得财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）有望超额完成官方借贷预测。【原文：Britain delivered a smaller-than-expected budget surplus in January, leaving Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves on track to overshoot official borrowing forecasts.】

item.title: 据说 CATL 供应商 Lead Intelligent 将为香港上市挑选银行
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，无锡立德智能装备股份有限公司已为在香港的第二次上市挑选了银行，这次上市可能筹集多达 5 亿美元的资金。【原文：Wuxi Lead Intelligent Equipment Co. has picked banks for a second listing in Hong Kong that could raise as much as $500 million, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 食品采购量激增，英国零售销售额创 5 月以来最大增幅
item.description: 由于食品需求强劲，抵消了消费者信心的疲软，年初英国零售额的增长比预期更为强劲。【原文：UK retail sales grew more strongly than expected at the start of the year, as robust demand for food offset weaker consumer confidence.】

item.title: 南非公司在非洲大陆首次囤积比特币
item.description: Altvest Capital Ltd.表示，该公司将成为非洲首家采用比特币作为主要财务储备资产的上市公司，该公司效仿了迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的Strategy.com公司自开始购买比特币以来推动股价飙升超过2400%的策略。【原文：Altvest Capital Ltd. said it will become the first listed company in Africa to adopt Bitcoin as its primary treasury reserve asset, emulating a strategy that propelled a more than 2,400% surge in Michael Saylor’s Strategy.com since it started buying the token.】

item.title: 蓬勃发展的欧洲股市令策略师们望尘莫及
item.description: 欧洲股市创下历史新高的涨势令许多策略师措手不及，他们竞相追赶，并对进一步的涨势持谨慎态度。【原文：The European stock market’s rally to record highs has caught many strategists by surprise, leaving them racing to catch up and cautious on further gains.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国 1 月零售销售增长超预期
TikTok 重返 iPhone，下载量翻番，Rednote 黯然失色
item.description: ByteDance Ltd. 的 TikTok 重新回到了美国的移动商店，而似乎准备取代它的应用程序的关注度却急剧下降。【原文：ByteDance Ltd.’s TikTok is back on US mobile stores and the app that seemed poised to take its place has suffered a precipitous drop in interest.】

item.title: 美国呼吁重新平衡经济，中国承诺提升服务业
item.description: 在美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）准备再次呼吁中国政府减少对出口的依赖之际，中国官员正在制定开发中国庞大客户群的计划。【原文：Chinese officials are mapping out plans for tapping the nation’s huge customer base, as US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent prepares to refresh calls for Beijing to decrease its dependence on exports.】

item.title: 欧盟加强与南非的关系，该国正面临特朗普的怒火
item.description: 欧盟最高外交官表示，欧盟和南非正在建立更紧密的关系，此前的分歧导致双方关系冷淡。【原文：The European Union and South Africa are forging closer ties after previous disagreements led to a frosty relationship, the bloc’s top diplomat said.】

item.title: 葛兰素史克股价下跌面临新激进主义运动的风险
item.description: 葛兰素史克公司（GSK Plc）在欧洲大型医药股中长期表现不佳。一些市场人士表示，随着关键药物专利即将到期，疫苗销售量下降，葛兰素史克可能会再次吸引激进投资者。【原文：GSK Plc is a long-term underperformer among Europe’s Big Pharma stocks. And with key drug patents set to expire and vaccine sales falling, some market participants say it may draw in activist investors again.】

item.title: 报道称日本集团可能寻求特斯拉交易，日产汽车股价大涨
item.description: 英国《金融时报》报道称，日本一个高层集团已为埃隆-马斯克的特斯拉公司制定了投资这家陷入困境的汽车制造商的计划，日产汽车公司股价随即大涨。【原文：Nissan Motor Co. shares jumped after the Financial Times reported that a high-level Japanese group has drawn up plans for Elon Musk’s Tesla Inc. to invest in the struggling carmaker.】

item.title: 德国政治必须在联盟数学上动真格
item.description:
选举可能只差几个零点几个百分点就会陷入混乱。【原文：

The election could be a few fractions of percentage points from incoherence.

】
